step.by: submitted by the Chair of the Committee following informal consultations

p.docTitle: Resolutions adopted by the General Assembly on 22 December 2023

p.docProponent: [on the report of the Fifth Committee (A/78/662, para. 83)]

content.p: Appropriations totalling 3,588,431,600 United States dollars are hereby approved for the following purposes:

p.span: Part I. Overall policymaking, direction and coordination

td.p: General Assembly and Economic and Social Council affairs and conference management
Part III. International justice and law
Part IV. International cooperation for development
Least developed countries, landlocked developing countries and small island developing States
United Nations system support for the African Union’s Agenda 2063: The Africa We Want
International drug control, crime and terrorism prevention and criminal justice
Part V. Regional cooperation for development
Economic and social development in Africa
Economic and social development in Asia and the Pacific
Economic and social development in Latin America and the Caribbean
Economic and social development in Western Asia
Part VI. Human rights and humanitarian affairs
International protection, durable solutions and assistance to refugees
Department of Management Strategy, Policy and Compliance
Office of Information and Communications Technology
Part X. Jointly financed administrative activities and special expenses
Construction, alteration, improvement and major maintenance

content.p: The Secretary-General shall be authorized to transfer credits between sections of the budget, with the concurrence of the Advisory Committee on Administrative and Budgetary Questions;

In addition to the appropriations approved under paragraph 1 above, an amount of 75,000 dollars is appropriated for 2024 from the accumulated income of the Library Endowment Fund for the purchase of books, periodicals, maps and library equipment and for such other expenses of the Library at the Palais des Nations in Geneva as are in accordance with the objects and provisions of the endowment.
Estimates of income totalling 345,399,000 United States dollars are approved as follows:
The income from staff assessment shall be credited to the Tax Equalization Fund in accordance with the provisions of General Assembly resolution 973 (X) of 15 December 1955;

Direct expenses of the United Nations Postal Administration, services to visitors, the sale of statistical products, catering operations and related services, garage operations, television services and the sale of publications not provided for under the budget appropriations shall be charged against the income derived from those activities.

docTitle.span: Financing of appropriations for the year 2024

intro.p:
Budget appropriations totalling 3,588,431,600 United States dollars, approved for 2024 by the General Assembly in paragraph 1 of resolution A above, shall be financed in accordance with regulations 3.1 and 3.2 of the Financial Regulations and Rules of the United Nations,
ST/SGB/2013/4 and ST/SGB/2013/4/Amend.1. as follows:

content.p: 30,675,200 dollars, representing the estimated income other than staff assessment income approved for 2024 under resolution B above;

113,645,900 dollars, as reflected in the financial performance report on the programme budget for 2022,
A/78/89. approved by the Assembly in section II of its resolution 78/253 of 22 December 2023;

3,444,110,500 dollars, representing the assessment on Member States in accordance with Assembly resolution 76/238 of 24 December 2021 on the scale of assessments for the apportionment of the expenses of the United Nations;

In addition, there shall be added an amount of 21,500,000 dollars, representing the commitment authority relating to special political missions approved by the General Assembly in section XVII of its resolution 78/253, resulting in a total amount to be assessed of 3,465,610,500 dollars;

There shall be set off against the assessment on Member States, in accordance with the provisions of General Assembly resolution 973 (X) of 15 December 1955, their respective share in the Tax Equalization Fund totalling 314,723,800 dollars related to the appropriations for 2024.
